arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen close on Bayern Munich while French giants suffer cup woe
arts.sum: In Italy, Juventus were held to their 13th draw in 20 Serie A games this season.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen continue pursuit of Bayern Munich with narrow Mainz win
arts.sum: Alejandro Grimaldo's stunning free-kick was the difference as Bayer Leverkusen kept the pressure on Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich with victory over Mainz. Patrik Schick of Leverkusen attempts to round Mainz goalkeeper Robin Zentner in a one-on-one situation - IMAGO/BEAUTIFUL SPORTS/Axel Kohring

Leverkusen enjoy an extra few hours rest after edging Dortmund under the Friday evening floodlights. Mainz have won six of their last seven, including a shock win over Bayern on their way up to the l...

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen vs. Mainz preview: In-form Werkself aim to keep pressure on Bayern
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen will look to extend their winning run and keep the pressure on Bayern Munich at the top of the table when they face the only team to have beaten the Bavarians in the league this season, Mainz.

arts.ttl: Tuesday's Bundesliga predictions including Bayer Leverkusen vs. Mainz
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's Bundesliga fixtures, including Bayer Leverkusen vs. Mainz.

arts.ttl: Predicted Bayer Leverkusen v Mainz XIs
arts.sum: Florian Wirtz is expected to return to Bayer Leverkusen’s starting line-up when they host Mainz at the BayArena on Tuesday evening. The 21-year-old was absent from the team that started…

arts.ttl: Jonathan Burkardt and Patrick Schick: Two Bundesliga goal-getters who have found their groove
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen's Patrik Schick and Mainz's Jonathan Burkardt have scored 18 goals between them across the last six matchdays, making the teams' meeting on Tuesday all the more of an enticing prospect. His eye-catching exploits over the past six weeks have seen him score two or more goals on three occasions already, including four in one game against European hopefuls Freiburg, who had only conceded four times across the three games before meeting Schick and his teammates on Matchday 15.

arts.ttl: Xabi Alonso guarantees Wirtz start against Mainz, gives update on Boniface
arts.sum: Speaking at a press conference on Monday, Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso confirmed that Florian Wirtz will start against Mainz. He also gave an update on Victor Boniface's injury.

arts.ttl: Tella lights Leverkusen fire as gap to Dortmund grows bigger than ever | Andy Brassell
arts.sum: England-born forward’s thunderous volley shocked Sahin’s flu-racked side who face fight for Champions League place Friday night’s resumption always carried the threat of pushing us towards drawing hard and fast conclusions for the second half of the season. In the end the raising of the curtain was so dramatic as not to leave us any other choice. Twenty-four seconds into the Rückrunde and, as Nathan Tella’s volley thundered past Gregor Kobel, we had our emphatic notice that the balance of power at the top of this season’s Bundesliga is not about to change any time soon. It was not the quickest statement by the standards of Dortmund versus Leverkusen, of course. Ten years ago last August, Karim Bellarabi scored the Bundesliga’s fastest goal, nine seconds into this fixture in the opening match of the 2014-15 Bundesliga season. The winger’s rapid strike set the tone for what turned out to be Jürgen Klopp’s final season at the helm, symbolically snuffing out their hopes of doing something significant with the campaign almost before it had begun. Continue reading...
